subject: Gardening
title: Touch-Sensitive Plants
description: A fast breakdown of Touch-Sensitive Plants for builders.

hook.text: Touch a Mimosa pudica leaf and it folds shut in half a second. The plant feels your finger.

buildup.text: Specialized cells at the base of each leaf lose water pressure on contact, collapsing like a deflating balloon.

discovery.text: This responseâ€”thigmonastyâ€”is triggered by calcium ion signals that travel through the plant at measurable speed.

twist.text: Mimosa can learn. When dropped repeatedly without harm, it stops folding. It remembers for weeks.

climax.text: A plant that feels touch and forms memories challenges everything we assume about what it means to be aware.

punchline.text: Some plants remember being touchedâ€”for weeks.

quiz.question: What happens when Mimosa pudica is repeatedly dropped without being harmed?
options: It folds faster each time as a stronger defense response
It stops folding and remembers the harmless stimulus for weeks
Its leaves permanently stay closed for protection
